Description.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $0.652 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This Budget Line Item (BLI) consists of three separate and distinct programs, the OPNAV N98 sponsored Aircraft Carrier Tactical Support Center (CV-TSC) program, the OPNAV N96 sponsored Sonar Dome Rubber Windows (SDRW) program, and the OPNAV N2N6 sponsored Undersea Warfare Decision Support System (USW-DSS) program.

FY 2020 TO FY 2021 INCREASE:
- FY 2020 ($8.967M) to FY 2021 ($9.286M) increase ($+0.319M) is driven by FY 2021 being the first year of planned USW-DSS Theater ASW (TASW) Build Out Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) efforts. These efforts are required to incorporate and field TASW upgrades to existing USW-DSS systems on afloat platforms and at shore node sites (laboratory and training) with an integrated Common Operational Picture (COP), as necessary for USW-DSS to operate in a multi-level security environment.

Program Descriptions:

AIRCRAFT CARRIER TACTICAL SUPPORT CENTER (CV-TSC) (Cost Code VM301):
The AN/SQQ-34 Aircraft Carrier Tactical Support Center (CV-TSC) program fields Anti-Submarine Warfare (ASW) and Surface Warfare (SUW) combat capability to the Aircraft Carrier. The program provides validation and certification for the proposed Engineering Changes fielded to CVNs. The program maintains interoperability with current and future interfaces; supports mission data exchange; improves track/sensor processing and analysis techniques; improves mission planning; improves data recording, reconstruction, and distribution; improves embedded simulation and training capabilities and implements cyber-security measures to effectively employ overall CVN Self Ship Defense System (SSDS) capabilities.  CV-TSC integrates sensor data from Off-Board Aircraft, Organic Platform Sensors, Minotaur Multi-Sensor Fused Track Data, Link-16 Track Data, SSDS Track Data, Global Command and Control System (GCCS) Over-the-Horizon Track Data, and Environmental and Threat Databases to assess the threat and assist the Tactical Action Officer (TAO) and Composite Warfare Commander (CWC) to effectively employ overall CVN self-defense capabilities. CV-TSC generates real-time ASW/SUW information and recommendations, tactical planning and employment of ASW/SUW assets, ASW/SUW sensor data processing and analysis, and distribution of tactically significant data. Aircraft supported include: MH-60R/S Seahawk, P-8 Poseidon, MQ-4C Triton, and future ASW/SUW aircraft.

SONAR DOME RUBBER WINDOWS (SDRWs) (Cost Code VM401):
AN/SQS-53 Sonar Dome Rubber Windows (SDRWs) are installed on all CG47 and DDG51 class ships (Initial Capabilities Document (ICD) for ASW, AN/SQQ-89(V) Operational Requirements Document (ORD) (#667-76-05)dated August 2005). This program provides emergency replacement, wire-reinforced, pressurized rubber acoustic windows and attachment hardware, which experience failure due to corrosion, fatigue, and impact damage. Ships with a severely damaged SDRW need to be dry-docked, so continually monitoring status of SDRWs and maintaining a ready inventory of replacement assets is a priority in order to keep ships on mission. The SDRW significantly improves the surface ship sonar performance by reducing flow-induced self-noise and by providing increased source level receiving and sensitivity resulting from reduced attenuation. This program provides production engineering in support of technical evaluations, failure analysis, implementation of the in-water one-side backscatter X-ray program, Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) refurbishments of production systems and field service engineering; and completion of engineering design work and material tests. This program also provides drawings, configuration management information, incorporation of new design and fabrication technology, incorporation of lessons learned and required testing, and constructs sub-elements to confirm single-stage cure of the SDRW production process.

UNDERSEA WARFARE DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM (USW-DSS) (Cost Code VM601):
USW-DSS is the Navy Program of Record ASW Command and Control (C2) Net-Centric system supporting the warfighter. USW-DSS provides an integrated, near-real time, net-centric ASW Common Tactical Picture (CTP) and Common Operational Picture (COP) for the Carrier Strike Groups (CSGs). USW-DSS is a C2 capability identified in the ASW Initial Capabilities Document (ICD), for the Sea Combat Commander (SCC) and Theater USW Commander (TUSWC). USW-DSS enables effective planning and execution of Undersea Warfare (USW) operations, optimizes placement of sensors for exploitation of the environment, manages available resources, balances operations versus risk, and provides a clear vulnerability assessment of the operational environment. USW-DSS shortens C2 decision processes for detection-to-engagement across multiple platforms, including those with low-bandwidth communications or intermittent connectivity. Tactical data such as tracks, environmental, and sensor processing data is ingested into USW-DSS through platform specific interfaces such as the AN/SQQ-89(V) Surface Ship ASW Combat System, the Global Command and Control System - Maritime (GCCS-M), and Aircraft Carrier Tactical Support Center (CV-TSC). USW-DSS processes this and other tactical data and supports intelligent dissemination of the data to unit level and theater level platforms in support of an enhanced USW tactical picture. USW-DSS provides USW Commanders with an expanded, net-centric USW collaborative capability across CSG platforms (CVNs, CGs, DDGs) as well as supporting shore nodes to include Commander Task Force (CTF), the Naval Oceanographic Processing Facility (NOPF), and Tactical Operations Center (TOC) and Mobile Tactical Operations Center (M-TOC). On afloat platforms, USW-DSS processing software is virtualized for portability and is hosted on the Integrated Shipboard Network System (ISNS) and Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) systems and implements a Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) with display generation and operator interfaces provided via USW-DSS hardware. For support and ashore nodes, USW-DSS processing software is hosted on Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) hardware. Future USW-DSS capability is phased to deliver timely and cost-effective software improvements to the warfighter via the Build / Fleet Capability Release (FCR) process funded under the USW-DSS RDT&EN Program Element (PE) 0604518N Project 3094 development program, for transition and fielding via the USW-DSS OPN BLI 2176 program. USW-DSS procurements are installed on CSG platforms and supporting shore nodes via permanent Ship Alterations (SHIPALTs). Workstation procurements are required to support ISNS and CANES configured ships as well as shore nodes.

USW-DSS NOTE:  In FY 2021, a major Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) effort will begin to incorporate and field Theater ASW (TASW) upgrades to existing USW-DSS systems on afloat platforms and at shore node sites (laboratory and training) with an integrated Common Operational Picture (COP), as necessary for USW-DSS to operate in a multi-level security environment.

[P40A / VM301 - AIRCRAFT CARRIER TACTICAL SUPPORT CENTER (CV-TSC)]: VM301 - AIRCRAFT CARRIER TACTICAL SUPPORT CENTER (CV-TSC)

[P40A / CV-TSC Technology Insert/Refresh & ECP Implementation]: Item Number 1.1 - Consists of Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and hardware/software changes/upgrades to previously fielded and in-production AN/SQQ-34 CV-TSC systems. Funding used to implement ECPs to correct deficiencies identified through Fleet use; upgrade unreliable components; replace obsolete components; and address Information Assurance (IA) issues.

[P40A / Minotaur Multi-Sensor Fused Track Build Out]: Item Number 1.2 - Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) effort required to incorporate and field Minotaur Multi-Sensor Fused Track upgrades via Interface Processing Racks to CV-TSC systems at shore sites (4) and Aircraft Carriers (8), and provide Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products including drawings and Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs).

[P40A / VM401 - SONAR DOME RUBBER WINDOWS (SDRWs)]: VM401 - SONAR DOME RUBBER WINDOWS (SDRWs)

[P40A / SDRW Procurement]: Item Number 2.1 - Procure SDRWs, shipping fixtures, and fairing angles for emergency replacement on all CG47 and DDG51 class hulls. This line provides emergency replacement, wire-reinforced, pressurized rubber acoustic windows and attachment hardware, which experience failure due to corrosion, fatigue, and impact damage. Ships with a severely damaged SDRW need to be dry-docked, so continually monitoring status of SDRWs and maintaining a ready inventory of replacement assets is a priority in order to keep ships on mission.

[P40A / SDRW Production Support]: Item Number 2.2 - Funding is provided for production engineering in support of technical evaluations, failure analysis, implementation of the in-water one-side backscatter X-ray program, Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) refurbishments, and field service engineering; and complete engineering design work and material tests. This program also provides drawings, configuration management information, new design and fabrication technology, incorporation of lessons learned and required testing, and construct sub-elements to confirm single-stage cure.

[P40A / VM601 - UNDERSEA WARFARE DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM (USW-DSS)]: VM601 - UNDERSEA WARFARE DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM (USW-DSS)

[P40A / USW-DSS Shore Sites and Tactical Trainers]: Item Number 3.1 - Consists of the last procurement of USW-DSS post-OPEVAL Build 2 shore site and Tactical Training Equipment (TTE) systems, which are full hardware/software suites. USW-DSS Build 3 will be loaded on all future shore site and TTE systems via the USW-DSS Tech Refresh program FY 2020 and following fiscal years.

[P40A / USW-DSS Tech Refresh]: Item Number 3.2 - Funding is for hardware/software technology upgrades to previously fielded USW-DSS afloat and shore sites, including Theater commands, support nodes, and Tactical Training Equipment (TTE). USW-DSS Tech Refresh will install an integrated, near-real time, net-centric ASW Common Tactical Picture (CTP) and Common Operational Picture (COP) on an electronic Master Tactical Plot (eMTP) for the Fleet and at critical shore command sites. Through USW-DSS Tech Refresh targeted architectural improvements developed under USW-DSS RDT&EN Program Element 0604518N Project 3094, Build 3 Fleet Change Request-1 (FCR-1) and follow-on FCRs will facilitate the migration of key components of USW-DSS onto existing installed systems in Fleet use. Tech Refreshes improve software scalability while keeping future hardware costs in check.

[P40A / USW-DSS Engineering Changes (ECs)]: Item Number 3.3 - Consists of Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and hardware/software changes/upgrades. Funding will be used to support Reliability, Maintainability, and Availability (RM&A) modifications, correct deficiencies identified through Fleet use, and upgrade of unreliable components.

[P40A / USW-DSS System Technical Support]: Item Number 3.4 - Funding is for USW-DSS program Software Support Activity (SSA) efforts in performing the following functions: generation/assessment of Software Problem Reports (SPRs)/Software Trouble Reports (STRs); responding to Fleet software change requests; Configuration Management (CM); software Quality Assurance (QA); software installation automation; and software recovery support.

[P40A / USW-DSS Production Support]: Item Number 3.5 - Consists of on-site engineering support; Consolidated Afloat Network and Enterprise Services (CANES) Integrated Product Team (IPT) Support; Information Assurance (IA) certification support; production quality assurance; system sustainability support; Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) product updates/support; status reporting and technical briefings; program office support; and all other production support efforts directly related to delivery of USW-DSS to both the Integrated Shipboard Network System (ISNS) and CANES systems, and ultimately to the Fleet.

[P40A / USW-DSS CANES S/W Shipsets]: Item Number 3.6 - Consists of initial loads of the latest USW-DSS software suite on new Consolidated Afloat Network and Enterprise Services (CANES) equipped ships.

[P40A / USW-DSS Theater ASW (TASW) Build Out]: Item Number 3.7 - Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) effort beginning in FY 2021 required to incorporate and field TASW upgrades to existing USW-DSS systems on afloat platforms and at shore node sites (laboratory and training) with an integrated Common Operational Picture (COP), as necessary for USW-DSS to operate in a multi-level security environment.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 TO FY 2021 INCREASE:
- FY 2020 ($8.967M) to FY 2021 ($9.286M) increase ($+0.319M) is driven by FY 2021 being the first year of planned USW-DSS Theater ASW (TASW) Build Out Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) efforts. These efforts are required to incorporate and field TASW upgrades to existing USW-DSS systems on afloat platforms and at shore node sites (laboratory and training) with an integrated Common Operational Picture (COP), as necessary for USW-DSS to operate in a multi-level security environment.

Name.val: 1) VM301 - AIRCRAFT CARRIER TACTICAL SUPPORT CENTER (CV-TSC)
3) VM601 - UNDERSEA WARFARE DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM (USW-DSS)
3.1) USW-DSS Shore Sites and Tactical Trainers
